definition: "roof" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 40), occurring in 家, 定, 安 etc/see also 寶蓋|宝盖[bao3 gai4]
to fill in a form/to write data in a box (on a questionnaire or web form)

sentences.english: Or writing a fantastic story, painting or sculpting.
sentences.chinese: 或寫一個不錯的故事，繪畫或雕像。

sentences.english: There was a long time when he wrote his own music without saying one word.
sentences.chinese: 有好長一段時間他寫自己的音樂，一聲也不吭。

sentences.english: Wanting to do him dirt, she sent his wife a poison-pen letter.
sentences.chinese: 施詭計就寫了一封惡意中傷的信給他的妻子。

sentences.english: The shooting script was actually based on two scripts (written separately by Welles and Mankiewicz) that Welles combined into one for the final version.
sentences.chinese: 威爾斯最終用的是他和曼凱維支寫的劇本的混編版。

sentences.english: Mr. Anderson was writing a book on the history of Denmark.
sentences.chinese: 安得森先生正在寫一本關於丹麥歷史的書。

sentences.english: The only thing one can write that is a bit serious—a love letter.
sentences.chinese: 唯一我們能夠寫的就是一板正經的情書。

sentences.english: I have also written a good essay, essay competitions among the best.
sentences.chinese: 我作文也寫的很好，徵文比賽名列前茅。

sentences.english: Write her a short love letter.
or read to him some of my own writings and been rewarded in return with praise unsparing.
sentences.chinese: 或者給他讀些我寫的作品，都得到了他極大的讚賞。

sentences.english: As it is I have been forced into becoming a sort of pamphleteer.
sentences.chinese: 事實是，我被迫成了一名寫小冊子的作家。

sentences.english: A beautiful ballad written by Hins Cheung.
sentences.chinese: 這是張敬軒寫的一首很優美動聽的歌曲。

sentences.english: Say, read the book you see smoke on the fetal well, easy to teratogenicity .
sentences.chinese: 就說你看到書上寫着抽菸對胎兒不好，容易致畸。

sentences.english: Suddenly I had the idea of writing a message in a bottle.
sentences.chinese: “我突然冒出了寫一封“瓶中信”的念頭。

sentences.english: You just type a few keys, “Happy birthday,” and you send that, and then you’re okay.
sentences.chinese: 只需要寫“生日快樂”，然後發出去就可以了。

sentences.english: How did Zhang Jiuling write so well?
sentences.chinese: 張九齡是怎麼寫出來的？

sentences.english: Their technique preferences are both brush stroke mainly expressed in color, and fine brushwork together with freehand brushwork.
sentences.chinese: 從表現技法看，大多偏愛工筆和兼工帶寫的方法。

definition: to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
this/these/(commonly pr. [zhei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing)
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
